irrelevant.action_point: In case of a housing finance company accepting / holding public deposits, the auditor shall include in their report a statement on whether the public deposits accepted by the housing finance company together with other borrowings viz. (i) from public by issue of unsecured non-convertible debentures/ bonds; (ii) from its shareholders (if it is a public limited company); and (iii) which are not excluded from the definition of ‘public deposit’, are within the limits admissible to the company as per the provisions of these directions.
irrelevant.circular_name: Reserve Bank of India (Housing Finance Companies) Directions, 2025

irrelevant.action_point: The ‘segregation from the rest of the portfolio’ for a Non-Performing Investment (NPI) as prescribed in clause 36(b) of the Directions means that such investments shall be segregated from other investments within the same category [i.e., HTM, AFS, or FVTPL (including HFT)] under which it was classified at initial recognition. Reclassification of the securities shall be guided by provisions of Chapter VI of the Master Direction.
irrelevant.circular_name: Master Direction - Classification, Valuation and Operation of Investment Portfolio of Commercial Banks (Directions), 2023

irrelevant.action_point: All Bank notes with scribbling / stain (including colour stain) on them continue to be legal tender. Such notes can be deposited or exchanged in any bank branch.

irrelevant.action_point: In Regulation 2 of the Foreign Exchange Management (Debt Instruments) Regulations, 2019, after clause (q), the following new clause shall be inserted: - "(qa) "Real Estate Investment Trust” or “REIT” means a business trust as defined in sub-clause (ii) of clause 13A of section 2 of the Income-tax Act, 1961."
irrelevant.circular_name: Foreign Exchange Management (Debt Instruments) (First Amendment) Regulations, 2021

irrelevant.action_point: For reporting Microfinance (MFI) data, including Self Help Group (SHG) data, Credit Institutions (CIs) shall use 'Form 3: Uniform Credit Reporting Format for MFIs'. It is recommended that a separate file is shared with CICs for SHG accounts and JLG + Individual accounts. All Microfinance borrowings in the names of individuals, regardless of the purpose, must be included in this format. The data must contain all live loan accounts during the relevant period, all accounts which got closed during the period, and all accounts which opened during the period.
irrelevant.circular_name: Reserve Bank of India (Asset Reconstruction Companies – Credit Information Reporting) Directions, 2025

For the parameter Capital (Breach of CRAR)², a UCB will be placed under Risk Threshold 1 if its CRAR is up to 250 bps below the Minimum Regulatory Requirement, as applicable for Tier 2 to 4 UCBs as per the glide path provided for achieving the regulatory minimum CRAR of 12% by March 31, 2026.
irrelevant.circular_name: Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) Framework for Primary (Urban) Co-operative Banks (UCBs)

irrelevant.action_point: The 'ACH Credit 3' session shall accept the following product type: ECS (Migrated).

irrelevant.action_point: Perpetual Debt Instruments (PDI) shall be subjected to a lock-in clause in terms of which the issuing bank shall not be liable to pay interest, if i) the bank's CRAR is below the minimum regulatory requirement prescribed by RBI; OR ii) the impact of such payment results in bank's capital to risk assets ratio (CRAR) falling below or remaining below the minimum regulatory requirement prescribed by RBI.
irrelevant.circular_name: Master Direction – Prudential Norms on Capital Adequacy for Local Area Banks (Directions), 2021

irrelevant.action_point: Regulatory changes under SBR applicable to NBFC-ML and NBFC-UL d) Key Managerial Personnel - Except for directorship in a subsidiary, Key Managerial Personnel shall not hold any office (including directorships) in any other NBFC-ML or NBFC-UL. A timeline of two years is provided with effect from October 01, 2022 to ensure compliance with these norms. It is clarified that they can assume directorship in NBFC-BLs.

irrelevant.action_point: Scheduled Commercial Banks are permitted to co-lend with registered Non-Banking Financial Companies (including Housing Finance Companies) for lending to the priority sector as per guidelines issued vide circular FIDD.CO.Plan.BC.No.8/04.09.01/2020-21 dated November 5, 2020. Loans extended as per guidelines on co-origination, issued vide circular No. FIDD.CO.Plan.BC/08/04.09.01/2018-19 dated September 21, 2018, would continue to be eligible for priority sector classification till repayment/maturity whichever is earlier. These provisions are not applicable to RRBs, UCBs, SFBs and LABS.
